intro: Senecio laetus, commonly known as the showy senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Senecio laetus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking appearance.
